At their Meeting held on 23rd February 1927 (Cabinet13(27) Conclusion 7) the Cabinet had before them a Memorandum(C.P.65(27)) by the Minister of Health containing proposalsfor dealing with the question of audit surcharges, and agreedto remit the matter to a Cabinet Committee composed of -The Minister of Health (Chairman) The Minister of Labour The First Commissioner of Works The Attorney General . The Financial Seoretary to the Treasury The Lord Advocate' 2. After discussing the proposals of the Minister of Health,the Committee came to the conclusion that they were open to criticism on the ground, inter alia, that they might be ineffective for the purpose for which they were intended.Accordingly I undertook to produce fresh proposals which after further discussion and modification have been accepted by the Committee * A draft Bill embodying these proposals is attached, and the Committee recommend that, subject to any amendments suggested by the Home Affairs Committee if the Bill be referred to that Committee, the Minister should be authorised to introduce the draft Bill into the House of Commons.Signed on behalf of the CommitteeMinistry of Health,8th April, 1927.N.
